title: Global Carbon Credit Trading Platform Market Analysis Report 2022 - Strategies Driving Net-Zero Goals to Boost ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global carbon credit trading platform market is expected to grow from USD 67.3 billion in 2022 to USD 200.6 billion by 2027, driven by efforts to curb global warming through carbon capture solutions and trading carbon credits. The regulated carbon market is anticipated to hold the largest market share due to compliance with greenhouse gas emission reduction goals. The utilities sector has the highest demand for carbon trading platforms, especially in Europe, which leads the market due to investments in clean power generation. Key players include Nasdaq, CME Group, and AirCarbon Exchange.
